workflow.name: Bulk WhatsApp & Gmail messenger with Google Sheets status tracking via InboxPlus
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow sends WhatsApp messages and emails in bulk using contact data stored in Google Sheets. Contacts are processed in small batches to control throughput and avoid API rate limits. WhatsApp and email are treated as independent channels and are sent only when their status is marked as pending. All success and failure results are written back to Google Sheets to enable tracking, retries, and safe re-runs.

## Step-by-step
- **Step 1: Fetch contacts & batch processing**
  - **Manual Trigger** ‚Äì Starts the workflow manually.
  - **Get Contacts** ‚Äì Reads contact data from Google Sheets.
  - **Split In Batches** ‚Äì Processes contacts in controlled batch sizes.

- **Step 2: Email preparation & sending**
  - **Has Email Address** ‚Äì Checks whether the contact has an email address.
  - **IF Mail Pending** ‚Äì Ensures the email is still marked as pending.
  - **PrepareEmail email** ‚Äì Loads the selected InboxPlus email template.
  - **Build HTML Email** ‚Äì Builds the final HTML email body.
  - **Fetch Email Image** ‚Äì Downloads images for inline or attachment usage.
  - **Send Gmail** ‚Äì Sends the email via Gmail.
  - **Delivered** ‚Äì Confirms successful email delivery.

- **Step 3: WhatsApp message sending**
  - **Has Phone Number** ‚Äì Checks whether the contact has a phone number.
  - **IF WhatsApp Pending** ‚Äì Ensures the WhatsApp message is still pending.
  - **Send template** ‚Äì Sends the approved WhatsApp template message.
  - **Sent** ‚Äì Confirms message acceptance by WhatsApp.

- **Step 4: Delivery status updates**
  - **Update Sheet** ‚Äì Writes successful delivery results back to Google Sheets.
  - **Mail Failure** ‚Äì Updates Google Sheets if email delivery fails.
  - **Whatsapp Failure** ‚Äì Updates Google Sheets if WhatsApp delivery fails.

## Why use this?
- Prevents duplicate messages with channel-level pending checks  
- Handles WhatsApp and email independently in one workflow  
- Supports safe retries without resending completed messages  
- Keeps Google Sheets as the single source of truth  
- Scales bulk outreach safely using batch-based execution

workflow.name: Multi-Channel Outreach Automation using Whatsapp, Inboxplus and Gmail

parameters.content:
## Bulk WhatsApp + Gmail Sender

This workflow sends WhatsApp messages and HTML emails in bulk using contact data stored in Google Sheets. Each contact is processed independently, allowing WhatsApp and Email to operate as separate, status-aware channels.

The workflow is designed to be safe to re-run. Messages are only sent if their respective channel is still marked as pending, preventing duplicate sends even if the workflow is executed multiple times.

Emails support three image delivery modes: inline images rendered inside the email body, attachments only, or both inline and attachment. This makes the workflow flexible for marketing emails, transactional messages, or internal notifications.

Contacts are processed in batches to control throughput and avoid API rate limits. After each message attempt, delivery results are written back to Google Sheets, creating a reliable source of truth for reporting and retries.

### How it works

	‚Ä¢	Reads contacts from Google Sheets
	‚Ä¢	Processes rows in controlled batches
	‚Ä¢	Checks channel-specific delivery status
	‚Ä¢	Sends WhatsApp and Email independently
	‚Ä¢	Updates delivery results back to the sheet

### Setup steps

	1.	Connect Google Sheets and select your contact sheet
	2.	Ensure the sheet includes Phone Number, Email, Message Sent and Mail Sent columns
	3.	Add WhatsApp Cloud API credentials and select a template
	4.	Add InboxPlus API credentials and select a template
	5.	Add Gmail OAuth credentials
	6.	Execute manually or activate for scheduled runs

## Step 1: Fetch contacts & batch processing

Reads contact data from Google Sheets and processes it in batches to control throughput and avoid API rate limits.

## Step 3: WhatsApp message sending

Checks if a phone number exists and the WhatsApp message is still pending, then sends the template and tracks delivery status.

## Step 2:  Email preparation & sending

Builds an HTML email, applies the selected image mode (inline, attachment, or both), and sends the email via Gmail.

## Step 4: Delivery status updates

Writes success or failure results for each channel back to Google Sheets to enable tracking and safe retries.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
